intro: Aporum kwashotense, commonly known as the Kwashotense arrowhead, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are typically a vibrant green with a slightly glossy texture. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, adding an ornamental value to its appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique foliage and ease of care, it is a popular choice for water gardens and shaded landscapes.
